item.title: Kernel Hearts adds PS5, Xbox Series, and Switch 2 versions
item.content:encoded:
• PS5
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

PC demo launches March 31.

Kernel Hearts will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and Switch 2 alongside its previously announced PC (Steam) version, publisher Whitethorn Games and developer Ephemera announced. A demo will be available for PC on March 31. A Fortnite collaboration is also planned.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Kernel Hearts is a unique blend of action RPG and roguelike elements with multiplayer cooperative play. As part of the M.A.H.O.U Unit, you are tasked with climbing the Tower of Babel, eliminating the angelic creatures in your path as you dethrone God and save a world drowning in ashes.

Key Features

  • One More God Rejected – Mix and match your attacks, spells, and movement with unique powers during each run to unleash devastating combos on the enemies you encounter. Punch biblical monsters in the face with up to four friends. Each level culminates in an intense boss fight against the domain’s guardian
  • Equip and Customize Your Units – After each expedition, you will return to the last memory backup in a laboratory located on the outskirts of humanity’s last holdout. Spend the rewards from each run to unlock and equip up to 256KB of chips onto your Unit MAHOU.OS, and customize them as you see fit.
  • Transform Into a Magical Girl – Harness the strength of the tower to dispel the Heavenly Curse from yourself, unleashing a devastating attack on nearby foes and attaining your true form for a short period.
  • Bond With Your Allies – Interact with the tower’s unique inhabitants and give them gifts to deepen your bond.


https://www.gematsu.com/2026/02/kernel-hearts-adds-ps5-xbox-series-and-switch-2-versions
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Colorbound launches in 2026 for PS5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, PS4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Puzzle platformer coming to all platforms.

Puzzle platformer Colorbound will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store in 2026, publisher Whitethorn Games and developer Panpipe Studios announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via Whitethorn Games:

About

In Colorbound, color is more than just hue. As Anku, an Aymara boy with a unique gift, you’ll harness the power of color to shape the environment itself, uncovering hidden paths to navigate challenging and complex puzzles.

Key Features

  • Single Player – Bring the world around you to life with the power of color in Colorbound, a vibrant palette-platformer. Join Anku on a heartfelt journey to reunite his late grandfather’s band by using color to shape the world around you. As you journey, you’ll solve puzzles, uncover secrets, and help a family of musicians come together one last time.
  • A Farewell Tour For Your Grandfather – Anku’s grandfather was a beloved musician to his people, but his band has long since scattered. Now, with only memories and a special gift, Anku must journey across diverse landscapes to find the missing musicians, reignite their passions, and give his grandfather the farewell he deserves. Along the way, you’ll use color to brighten the canvas, turning obstacles into opportunities, and puzzles into music!
  • Change Colors to Change The World – In Colorbound, you will collect colors onto your palette, which can be used to overcome logic and light platforming puzzles. From lush forests to forgotten cities, Colorbound‘s overworld offers a variety of mind-bending puzzles that span a variety of locations and aesthetics.
  • Finding Balance – Not all colors behave the same way. Some may be lighter, allowing objects to float away once painted, while other colors are heavier and may drop down. Using this to your advantage can help Anku cross the treacherous terrain to reach his destination.
  • Rooted in Culture – Colorbound draws inspiration from the Aymara culture of the Andes, blending traditional music and art styles with an indie-gem-inspired puzzle platformer experience. Informed by Panpipe Studio’s Chilean culture and heritage, Colorbound celebrates the rich culture of South America while delivering a universal story of love, loss, and the power of art.


https://www.gematsu.com/2026/02/colorbound-launches-in-2026-for-ps5-xbox-series-switch-2-ps4-xbox-one-switch-and-pc

item.title: This Week’s Japanese Game Releases: Yakuza Kiwami 3 & Dark Ties, Mario Tennis Fever, more
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

BlazBlue: Entropy Effect X, REANIMAL, etc.

Yakuza Kiwami 3 & Dark Ties for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch 2, Switch, and PC, and Mario Tennis Fever for Switch 2 are the highlights of this week’s Japanese video game releases.

Also due out this week are BlazBlue: Entropy Effect X for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and Switch, REANIMAL for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, and PC, and the PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series versions of Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma.

Get the full list of this week’s Japanese game releases below. It should be noted that Gematsu will receive a small percentage of money from purchases made through Play-Asia links. You can also save five percent with our multi-use “GEMATSU2025” coupon code.

Physical and Digital

  • BlazBlue: Entropy Effect X (PS5, Switch) – Launching worldwide.
    • North American Version (PS5, Switch)
    • European Version (PS5, Switch)
  • Cattle Country (PS5, Switch) – Already available worldwide.
  • Mario Tennis Fever (Switch 2) – Launching worldwide.
    • North American Version (Switch 2)
    • European Version (Switch 2)
  • REANIMAL (PS5, Switch 2) – Game-key card on Switch 2. Launching worldwide.
    • Collector’s Edition (PS5, Switch 2)
    • North American Version (PS5, Xbox Series, Switch 2)
    • European Version
      • Standard Edition (PS5, Xbox Series, Switch 2)
      • Deluxe Edition (PS5, Xbox Series, Switch 2)
      • Collector’s Edition (PS5, Xbox Series, Switch 2)
    • Asian Version (PS5, Switch 2)
  • RIDE 6 (PS5) – Launching worldwide.
    • European Version (PS5, Xbox Series)
    • Asian Version (PS5)
  • Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma (PS5) – Launching worldwide.
    • North American Version (PS5)
    • European Version (PS5)
    • Asian Version (PS5)
  • Yakuza Kiwami 3 & Dark Ties (PS5, Switch 2, PS4) – Launching worldwide.
    • North American Version (PS5, Xbox Series, Switch 2)
    • European Version (PS5, Switch 2)
    • Asian Version (PS5, Switch 2, PS4)

Digital-Only

  • BlazBlue: Entropy Effect X (Xbox Series) – Launching worldwide.
  • Cash Cleaner Simulator (PS5, Xbox Series) – Launching worldwide.
  • ChromaGun 2: Dye Hard (PS5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, PC [Steam, Epic Games Store]) – Launching worldwide.
    • North American Version (PS5, Xbox Series, Switch 2)
    • European Version (PS5, Switch 2)
  • Console Archives Cool Boarders (PS5) – Launching worldwide.
  • Console Archives Ninja Gaiden II: The Dark Sword of Chaos (PS5) – Launching worldwide.
  • Crisol: Theater of Idols (PS5, Xbox Series, PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Dear me, I was… (Switch, PC [Steam], iOS, Android) – Launching worldwide.
  • Disciples: Domination (PS5, Xbox Series, PC [Steam, Epic Games Store, Microsoft Store]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Fantasista Asuka (Switch, PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • KILLER INN Early Access (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • PopSlinger Vol. 2: Loveless (Xbox Series) – Launching worldwide.
  • Pure Pool Pro (PS5, PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • REANIMAL (Xbox Series, PC [Steam, Epic Games Store, GOG, Microsoft Store]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Roadside Research Early Access (Xbox Series, PC [Steam, Microsoft Store]) – Launching worldwide.
  • ROMEO IS A DEAD MAN (PS5, Xbox Series, PC [Steam, Microsoft Store]) – Launching worldwide.
  • RIDE 6 (Xbox Series, PC [Steam, Epic Games Store]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma (Xbox Series) – Launching worldwide.
  • Starsand Island Early Access (Xbox Series, PC [Steam, Microsoft Store]) – Launching worldwide.
  • TOKYO SCRAMBLE (Switch 2) – Launching worldwide.
  • Yakuza Kiwami 3 & Dark Ties (Xbox Series, Xbox One, PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.

The PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, and Switch titles listed above can be purchased through Japanese PlayStation Network and Nintendo accounts using prepaid cards:

  • PlayStation Store cards (yen): 1,100 / 3,000 / 5,000 / 10,000
  • Nintendo eShop cards (yen): 1,000 / 1,500 / 3,000 / 5,000 / 9,000

Demos, DLC, Updates, etc.

  • Absolum “Threads of Fate” Update (PS5, PS4, Switch, PC)
  • Granblue Fantasy Versus: Rising Downloadable Content Character Ilsa (PS5, PS4, PC)
  • Honkai: Star Rail Version 4.0 Update “No Aha At Full Moon” (PS5, PC, iOS, Android)
  • Lil Gator Game Downloadable Content “In the Dark” (PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, Switch, PC)
